newsitem.title: UK: Greenpeace launches environment-friendly credit card.
newsitem.headline: Greenpeace launches environment-friendly credit card.

text.p: Greenpeace and a British bank on Wednesday launched an environmentally friendly credit card which is almost entirely free of the polluting plastic PVC (polyvinyl chloride).
The Greenpeace credit card, developed with Co-operative Bank Plc, is made of a biodegradeable material called Biopol, which is produced by cereal plants.
"The Greenpeace card is a real breakthrough for the environment," said Greenpeace executive director Peter Melchett.

"Until now all credit cards have been produced from PVC. This alternative carries the Greenpeace name because it will directly reduce the pollution caused by the manufacture and disposal of PVC," Melchett said.
Biopol plastic is 100 percent free of PVC but the magnetic strip on the back of the card and some of the inks still contain traces of the plastic.
Greenpeace has been campaigning for alternatives to PVC for several years. It says the production and disposal of PVC causes harmful chemicals to be released into environment.
